content.description: - SDS left bottom of half moon boulder on front face and traverse across middle and to the right   - crimpy traverse with some nice eliminates.
content.location: continue left past Thin Blue Flame

content.description: - start under triangle shaped overhang near middle of front face of Uphill Crag II.    - work up around triangle overhang and to the right.   - start to traverse right about 10 feet worth   - continue nearly straight up to top out same as Gold Leafed Pyramids
content.location: head around corner from right face of crag and start near middle of front face.

content.description: - follow crack up for 15 feet or so....crack deviates right after 8 feet or so.   - nice ledge about 15 feet up   - gets pretty juggy with slight back lean last 1/3 of route
content.protection: top rope...bring plenty of webbing as anchor points back from ledge a good bit.

content.description: - SDS left bottom of diagonal/uphill leaning slab   - follow top edge to top/point   - good holds all way thru to top out point.    - mind small rocks along length of bottom
content.location: left most worthwhile exposed rock....continue to left face of crag and uphill a bit

content.description:
- a good warm up problem just right of Magnolia Moss. 

  - SDS near small cave/undercut and work up crimpy and small block face to top of point to top out. 

  - all and all pretty slabby and good warm up stuff
content.location: just right and towards small cave/undercut of rock from Magnolia Moss

content.description: - first route just left of double trees that make up corner of right face and front face of crag   - work straight up with lots of eliminates to top out   - same top out finish as Thin Blue Flame and Gold Leafed Pyramid

- start right to the right of the double trees on left corner.   - start by working straight up slight overhang and use solid pockets about 1/2 way up.    - another small overhang about 2/3 up before top out.
content.protection: top rope.  bring extra webbing d/t possible anchor points back from ledge a bit.

content.description:
toughest part of this route is first 10 feet...super small crimps all spread out fair bit

 once up and over crimpy area mainly solid holds and jugs rest of way.
content.protection: a few good natural anchors about 10 meters back from cliff ledge....bring plenty of long webbing for top rope set up.
content.location: on side of crag that faces Uphill Crag I

content.description:
- stay right of small tree growing off of first ledge. 

  - work up slabby stuff and then work main crack on moderate roof/overhang 

  - continue up overhang until about halfway and follow the small crack up to top out.
content.location: located about middle of left face of rock...to the right of small sapling growing out first ledge.

content.description:
The sibling of Uphill Crag I. 

  Easily visible and nearly a stones throw away.  

  If facing Uphill Crag I it's off to the left.  

  More difficult climbing at this crag. 

  Top roping is doable but a bit more tricky, as no trees super close to edge.
